Message.Issue: Add [Serializable] to 'NoSuchEventException' as this type implements ISerializable.
Add [Serializable] to 'UserNotFoundException' as this type implements ISerializable.

Implement IDisposable on 'CommentOperations' because it creates members of the following IDisposable types: 'BookReadingEventManagementContext'. If 'CommentOperations' has previously shipped, adding new members that implement IDisposable to this type is considered a breaking change to existing consumers.

Implement IDisposable on 'EventOperations' because it creates members of the following IDisposable types: 'BookReadingEventManagementContext'. If 'EventOperations' has previously shipped, adding new members that implement IDisposable to this type is considered a breaking change to existing consumers.

Implement IDisposable on 'InviteOperations' because it creates members of the following IDisposable types: 'BookReadingEventManagementContext'. If 'InviteOperations' has previously shipped, adding new members that implement IDisposable to this type is considered a breaking change to existing consumers.

Implement IDisposable on 'UserOperations' because it creates members of the following IDisposable types: 'BookReadingEventManagementContext'. If 'UserOperations' has previously shipped, adding new members that implement IDisposable to this type is considered a breaking change to existing consumers.

Rule.Name: Mark ISerializable types with SerializableAttribute
Rule.Description: The System.Runtime.Serialization.ISerializable interface allows the type to customize its serialization, while the Serializable attribute enables the runtime to recognize the type as being serializable.
Rule.Resolution: Add [Serializable] to {0} as this type implements ISerializable.

Rule.Name: Types that own disposable fields should be disposable
Rule.Description: Types that declare disposable members should also implement IDisposable. If the type does not own any unmanaged resources, do not implement a finalizer on it.
Rule.Resolution: Implement IDisposable on {0} because it creates members of the following IDisposable types: {1}. If {0} has previously shipped, adding new members that implement IDisposable to this type is considered a breaking change to existing consumers.
